verses.verse: Let me sing <WH7891> for my wellbeloved <WH3039> a song <WH7892> of my beloved <WH3039> touching his vineyard <WH3754>. My wellbeloved <WH3039> had a vineyard <WH3754> in a very fruitful <WH1121> hill <WH7161>:

and he digged <WH5823> it <WH5619>, and gathered out the stones thereof <WH5193>, and planted it with the choicest vine <WH8321>, and built <WH1129> a tower <WH4026> in the midst <WH8432> of it <WH2672>, and also hewed out a winepress <WH3342> therein <WH6960>: and he looked that it should bring forth <WH6213> grapes <WH6025>, and it brought forth <WH6213> wild grapes <WH891>.
And now <WH3427>, O inhabitants of Jerusalem <WH3389> and men <WH376> of Judah <WH3063>, judge <WH8199>, I pray you <WH3754>, betwixt me and my vineyard.

What could have been done <WH6213> more to my vineyard <WH3754>, that I have not done <WH6213> in it <WH4069>? wherefore, when I looked <WH6960> that it should bring forth <WH6213> grapes <WH6025>, brought it forth <WH6213> wild grapes <WH891>?

And now I will tell <WH3045> you what I will do <WH6213> to my vineyard <WH3754>: I will take away <WH5493> the hedge <WH4881> thereof <WH1197>, and it shall be eaten up; I will break down <WH6555> the wall <WH1447> thereof <WH4823>, and it shall be trodden down:

and I will lay <WH7896> it waste <WH1326>; it shall not be pruned <WH2168> nor hoed <WH5737>; but there shall come up <WH5927> briers <WH8068> and thorns <WH7898>: I will also command <WH6680> the clouds <WH5645> that they rain <WH4305> no rain upon it <WH4306>.

For the vineyard <WH3754> of Jehovah <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> is the house <WH1004> of Israel <WH3478>, and the men <WH376> of Judah <WH3063> his pleasant <WH8191> plant <WH5194>: and he looked <WH6960> for justice <WH4941>, but <WH4939>, behold, oppression; for righteousness <WH6666>, but <WH6818>, behold, a cry.

Woe <WH1945> unto them that join <WH5060> house <WH1004> to house <WH1004>, that lay <WH7126> field <WH7704> to field <WH7704>, till there be no <WH657> room <WH4725>, and ye be made to dwell <WH3427> alone in the midst <WH7130> of the land <WH776>!

In mine ears <WH241> saith Jehovah <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635>, Of a truth <WH3808> many <WH7227> houses <WH1004> shall be desolate <WH8047>, even great <WH1419> and fair <WH2896>, without inhabitant <WH3427>.
For <WH3588> ten <WH6235> acres <WH6776> of vineyard <WH3754> shall yield <WH6213> one <WH259> bath <WH1324>, and a homer <WH2563> of seed <WH2233> shall yield <WH6213> but an ephah <WH374>.

Woe <WH1945> unto them that rise up early <WH7925> in the morning <WH1242>, that they may follow <WH7291> strong drink <WH7941>; that tarry <WH309> late into the night <WH5399>, till wine <WH3196> inflame them <WH1814>!

And the harp <WH3658> and the lute <WH5035>, the tabret <WH8596> and the pipe <WH2485>, and wine <WH3196>, are in their feasts <WH4960>; but they regard <WH5027> not the work <WH6467> of Jehovah <WH3068>, neither have they considered <WH7200> the operation <WH4639> of his hands <WH3027>.

Therefore my people <WH5971> are gone into captivity <WH1540> for lack of knowledge <WH1847>; and their honorable <WH3519> men <WH4962> are famished <WH7458>, and their multitude <WH1995> are parched <WH6704> with thirst <WH6772>.

Therefore Sheol <WH7585> hath enlarged <WH7337> its desire <WH6310>, and opened <WH6473> its mouth <WH6310> without measure <WH2706>; and their glory <WH1926>, and their multitude <WH1995>, and their pomp <WH7588>, and he that rejoiceth <WH5938> among them <WH3381>, descend into it.
And the mean man <WH120> is bowed down <WH7817>, and the great man <WH376> is humbled <WH8213>, and the eyes <WH5869> of the lofty <WH1364> are humbled <WH8213>:
but Jehovah <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> is exalted <WH1361> in justice <WH4941>, and God <WH410> the Holy <WH6918> One is sanctified <WH6942> in righteousness <WH6666>.
Then shall the lambs <WH3532> feed <WH7462> as in their pasture <WH1699>, and the waste places <WH2723> of the fat ones <WH4220> shall wanderers <WH1481> eat <WH398>.
Woe <WH1945> unto them that draw <WH4900> iniquity <WH5771> with cords <WH2256> of falsehood <WH7723>, and sin <WH2403> as it were with a cart <WH5699> rope <WH5688>;

that say <WH559>, Let him make speed <WH4116>, let him hasten <WH2363> his work <WH4639>, that we may see <WH7200> it <WH6098>; and let the counsel of the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel <WH3478> draw nigh <WH7126> and come <WH935>, that we may know it <WH3045>!

Woe <WH1945> unto them that call <WH559> evil <WH7451> good <WH2896>, and good <WH2896> evil <WH7451>; that put <WH7760> darkness <WH2822> for light <WH216>, and light <WH216> for darkness <WH2822>; that put <WH7760> bitter <WH4751> for sweet <WH4966>, and sweet <WH4966> for bitter <WH4751>!
Woe <WH1945> unto them that are wise <WH2450> in their own eyes <WH5869>, and prudent <WH995> in their own sight <WH6440>!
Woe <WH1945> unto them that are mighty <WH1368> to drink <WH8354> wine <WH3196>, and men <WH582> of strength <WH2428> to mingle <WH4537> strong drink <WH7941>;
that justify <WH6663> the wicked <WH7563> for <WH6118> a bribe <WH7810>, and take away <WH5493> the righteousness <WH6666> of the righteous from him <WH6662>!

Therefore as the tongue of fire <WH784> devoureth <WH398> the stubble <WH7179>, and as the dry grass <WH2842> sinketh down <WH7503> in the flame <WH3956>, so their root <WH8328> shall be as rottenness <WH4716>, and their blossom <WH6525> shall go up <WH5927> as dust <WH80>; because they have rejected <WH3988> the law <WH8451> of Jehovah <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635>, and despised <WH5006> the word <WH565> of the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel <WH3478>.

Therefore is the anger <WH639> of Jehovah <WH3068> kindled <WH2734> against his people <WH5971>, and he hath stretched forth <WH5186> his hand <WH3027> against them <WH5221>, and hath smitten them <WH2022>; and the mountains tremble <WH7264>, and their dead bodies <WH5038> are as refuse <WH5478> in the midst <WH7130> of the streets <WH2351>. For all this his anger <WH639> is not turned away <WH7725>, but his hand <WH3027> is stretched out still <WH5186>.

And he will lift up <WH5375> an ensign <WH5251> to the nations <WH1471> from far <WH7350>, and will hiss <WH8319> for them from the end <WH7097> of the earth <WH776>; and <WH935>, behold, they shall come with speed <WH4120> swiftly <WH7031>.

None shall be weary <WH5889> nor stumble <WH3782> among them <WH5123>; none shall slumber nor sleep <WH3462>; neither shall the girdle <WH232> of their loins <WH2504> be loosed <WH6605>, nor the latchet <WH8288> of their shoes <WH5275> be broken <WH5423>:

whose arrows <WH2671> are sharp <WH8150>, and all their bows <WH7198> bent <WH1869>; their horses <WH5483>' hoofs <WH6541> shall be accounted <WH2803> as flint <WH6862>, and their wheels <WH1534> as a whirlwind <WH5492>:

their roaring <WH7581> shall be like a lioness <WH3833>, they shall roar <WH7580> like young lions <WH3715>; yea <WH5098>, they shall roar, and lay hold <WH270> of the prey <WH2964>, and carry it away safe <WH6403>, and there shall be none to deliver <WH5337>.

And they shall roar <WH5098> against them in that day <WH3117> like the roaring <WH5100> of the sea <WH3220>: and if one look <WH5027> unto the land <WH776>, behold <WH2822>, darkness and distress <WH6862>; and the light <WH216> is darkened <WH2821> in the clouds thereof <WH6183>.
